ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Another question...somebody STOP me :-)
ygData.msgSnippet: Thanks for this info Rob.  Actually i set them up on Fennin even though I had to pick some different names and change the spelling of my dear Barbarian Naara.
ygData.messageBody:
Thanks for this info Rob. Actually i set them up on
Fennin even though I had to pick some different names
and change the spelling of my dear Barbarian Naara.
On Fennin she is Naera...then I have my Druid, Amaiya
and my Cleric is Diahni(pronounced Dieawnee)...I even
have my own account now WOOOOWHOOOOO....I have also
kept my characters on Ayonae and will play them on
occasion I am sure since they are very special to
me...Thanks for the website into..Have been to
Alakazam but not Everlore...will check that one out at
lunch :-) Wish I had read this post before I set up
the new characters so I could have gone to Druzzil...I
still have some "characters" left...I could make one
for Druzzil yes? Ok, back to work with me...

Naera, the Evercurious
Fennin Ro


--- MiniGamer <rlebeau65@...> wrote:
> Play on Druzzil Ro.
> I have a Druid level 15.
>
> You can go to sites like Alakazam and Everlore.com
> to
> find Great info without someone leading you by the
> hand. It gives pointers and ideas which should help
> you build a character.
>
> Be careful in Kelethin since it is a hard area to
> learn.
>
> Yes, you need to hunt. The only way you will level.
>
> Good luck and if you choose Druzzil , let me know
>
> Good Luck
>
> Rob
> --- nara MKs <masterkiis_nara@...> wrote:
> >
> > Ok..i have decided my new character will probably
> be
> > a
> > Wood Elf Druid, i think i have her name picked out
> > (even a last name should i EVER get that far..lol)
> > Not
> > sure what server i will play on yet but....my
> > question
> > is, is there anywhere i can read about what i
> should
> > do first as a new character and yadda, yadda,
> > yadda....See the problem with my boyfriend being
> > experienced in the game is that he did it ALL for
> > me,
> > or led me around by the collar doing it all for me
> > :-P...i want to do this on my own and have no idea
> > where to start...Do i just jump out there and
> start
> > killing critters or run around and hope i can find
> > my
> > way back from wherever i leave?? i know i sound
> > foolish but it is really important to do this on
> my
> > own..how else can one really learn?? Help is
> great
> > and i really do appreciate it but i also want to
> > feel
> > like i have accomplished something
> personally...Does
> > that make sense...
> >
> > The Evercurious,
> > Naara
